net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.util

Class ComponentRenderer

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.proteusframework.ui.miwt.util.ComponentRenderer

  • public final class ComponentRenderer
extends Object
    Utility class for component rendering.
    Author:
    Pat B. Double (double@i2rd.com)

    • Method Detail

      • appendCGIParameter

        public static void appendCGIParameter(StringBuilder buf,
                                      String name,
                                      String... values)
        Append CGI parameters to the StringBuilder. If data exists in the StringBuilder an ampersand is appended. When more than one value is specified, multiple parameters are added. Each value after the first uses the name suffixed with an underscore and the array index.
        Parameters:
        buf - The StringBuilder.
        name - The parameter name.
        values - The parameter values.

      • appendCGIParameter

        public static void appendCGIParameter(StringBuilder buf,
                                      String name,
                                      String value)
        Append a CGI parameter to the StringBuilder. If data exists in the StringBuilder an ampersand is appended.
        Parameters:
        buf - The StringBuilder.
        name - The parameter name.
        value - The parameter value.

      • appendJavaScriptPrefix

        public static void appendJavaScriptPrefix(HTMLRenderContext context,
                                          String attribute,
                                          StringBuilder buf)
        Append the prefix for indicating an event handler is JavaScript. Normally this is "javascript: ", but some browsers don't support it.
        Parameters:
        context - The rendering context.
        attribute - The attribute in which the JavaScript is included.
        buf - The StringBuilder.

        Parameters:
        buf - The StringBuilder.
        anchor - The anchor.

      • printCommonAttributes

        public static void printCommonAttributes(HTMLRenderContext context,
                                         Component com,
                                         LayoutConstraint constraint,
                                         @Nullable
                                         String extraDisplayClasses)

        Print common attributes. These are tag attributes, the enclosing tag must be handled externally from this method. The attributes output are those that a layout renderer would not output.


        Included attributes are (using CSS where appropriate):
        • width
        • class
        • Custom attributes - Component.getAttributes()
        Parameters:
        context - The rendering context.
        com - The component.
        constraint - The layout constraint.
        extraDisplayClasses - extra display classes, may be null.

      • printHRefNoop

        public static void printHRefNoop(HTMLRenderContext context)
        Output the href for no operation. This includes the "href" attribute.
        Parameters:
        context - The rendering context.

      • printJavaScriptNoop

        public static void printJavaScriptNoop(HTMLRenderContext context,
                                       String attribute)
        Output the JavaScript for no operation. Note that the JavaScript prefix is not included in this method. Normally this will be "void(0);".
        Parameters:
        context - The rendering context.
        attribute - The attribute in which the JavaScript is included.

      • printJavaScriptPrefix

        public static void printJavaScriptPrefix(HTMLRenderContext context,
                                         String attribute)
        Output the prefix for indicating an event handler is JavaScript. Normally this is "javascript: ", but some browsers don't support it.
        Parameters:
        context - The rendering context.
        attribute - The attribute in which the JavaScript is included.

        constraint - The constraints.
        hcontext - The render context.
        text - The text to be enclosed by the font tags.

      • render

        public static void render(Component comp,
                          @Nullable
                          LayoutConstraint constraint,
                          HTMLRenderContext hcontext,
                          CharSequence text,
                          boolean useConstraint)
        Renders text based on the attributes of the component.
        Parameters:
        comp - The component.
        constraint - The constraints.
        hcontext - The render context.
        text - The text to render.
        useConstraint - true to use constraint values.

      • render

        public static void render(HTMLRenderContext context,
                          Color color)
        Render an HTML color suitable for inclusion in an attribute value. Output is of the form #334455.
        Parameters:
        context - The render context.
        color - The color

      • renderButton

        public static void renderButton(HTMLRenderContext hcontext,
                                Component component,
                                String id,
                                ButtonDisplayWrapper display,
                                CharSequence toolTip,
                                boolean active,
                                String displayClass)
        Renders a button that does not necessarily submit.
        Parameters:
        hcontext - The render context.
        component - optional associated component. Pass null if the component doesn't represent a button itself but instead has a button as part of its interface.
        id - The ID for the button or null to generate an ID.
        display - The display attributes for the button.
        toolTip - An optional tool tip, may be null in which case the description or text (if the description is null) will be used from the display argument.
        active - Active status of the button.
        displayClass - the display class, may be null.

      • renderButton

        public static void renderButton(HTMLRenderContext hcontext,
                                @Nullable
                                Component component,
                                String id,
                                ButtonDisplayWrapper display,
                                @Nullable
                                CharSequence toolTip,
                                boolean active,
                                @Nullable
                                String displayClass,
                                EnumSet<Component.HTMLFeature> features)
        Renders a button that does not necessarily submit.
        Parameters:
        hcontext - The render context.
        component - optional associated component. Pass null if the component doesn't represent a button itself but instead has a button as part of its interface.
        id - The ID for the button or null to generate an ID.
        display - The display attributes for the button.
        toolTip - An optional tool tip, may be null in which case the description or text (if the description is null) will be used from the display argument.
        active - Active status of the button.
        displayClass - the display class, may be null.
        features - optional features to output in addition to the features specified on the optional component.

      • renderContentAndAttributes

        public static void renderContentAndAttributes(Component com,
                                              LayoutConstraint constraint,
                                              HTMLRenderContext context,
                                              @Nullable
                                              String enclosingTag,
                                              boolean enclosingTagRequired)
        Render content for the given component along with display attributes. This is different from renderContent in that attributes such as background images, colors, etc will be handled. Not that LayoutRenderer instances should not call this method if they directly support these attributes. This method should call renderContent as part of its processing. ID and display class attributes should also be applied.
        Parameters:
        com - The Component to render.
        constraint - The LayoutConstraint for the component.
        context - The rendering context.
        enclosingTag - The enclosing tag to use when necessary for applying attributes.
        enclosingTagRequired - true if the enclosing tag needs to be output, false to output only when needed.

      • renderHyperlinkComponent

        public static void renderHyperlinkComponent(Hyperlink hyperlink,
                                            HTMLRenderContext hcontext)
        Render component for a hyperlink.
        Parameters:
        hyperlink - the hyperlink.
        hcontext - the render context.

      • renderSubmitButton

        public static void renderSubmitButton(HTMLRenderContext context,
                                      @Nullable
                                      Component component,
                                      String name,
                                      ButtonDisplayWrapper display,
                                      @Nullable
                                      CharSequence toolTip,
                                      boolean active,
                                      @Nullable
                                      String displayClass)
        Renders a button that submits.
        Parameters:
        context - The rendering context.
        component - optional associated component. Pass null if the component doesn't represent a button itself but instead has a button as part of its interface.
        name - the name of the element.
        display - The button display properties.
        active - Active status of the button.
        toolTip - An optional tool tip, may be null in which case the description or text (if the description is null) will be used from the display argument.
        displayClass - The display class, may be null.
